data.headline: Stocks open lower as hawkish Fed minutes and a widening trade deficit dampen rate-cut hopes while geopolitical tensions lift oil and gold prices
bullets: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 all trade lower after futures slide on Fed minutes and trade data.
Fed minutes reveal a divided, hawkish stance, curbing expectations for near-term rate cuts.
December trade deficit widens to $70.3B, one of the largest annual gaps since 1960, overshadowing resilient jobless claims.
US-Iran tensions push oil to six-month highs, boosting energy and gold sectors but adding risk-off pressure to tech stocks after Nvidia's AI-driven rally.
Walmart drops 3â€“4% despite a Q4 beat as cautious FY27 EPS guidance misses consensus, weighing on retail and broader indices.
DoorDash, Deere, Quanta Services, and Etsy rally on strong earnings and deal news.
Carvana, Wayfair, and Stellantis slide on disappointing results or outlooks.
Traders are now focused on tomorrow's Q4 GDP data for further market direction.
